hints.content:
Area is the number of square units that cover a shape.

We need to find a rectangle with the same area.

Let's imagine that we finish drawing the unit squares in the rectangle.

- How many rows of unit squares would there be? 

- How many unit squares would be in each row?

[[☃ image 1]]

The rectangle has $\blueE{9}$ rows with $\maroonD{6}$ unit squares per row.

options.alt: A rectangle covered by a grid of unit squares with 9 rows and 6 columns. A curved bracket across the bottom of the rectangle is labeled 6 units and a curved bracket to the right side of the rectangle is labeled 9 units. !

hints.content:
We would use the same number of unit squares to cover this rectangle, so it would have the same area:

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A rectangle with the right side labeled 9 units and the bottom side labeled 6 units. !

question.content:
The following rectangle is partially covered with unit squares.

[[☃ image 1]]

**Which figure has the same area as the rectangle above?**

[[☃ radio 1]]

options.alt: A rectangle divided by a partially complete grid of unit squares with 9 rows and 6 columns. Part of the rectangle is divided into 14 equal-sized squares. The remainder of the rectangle shows partially drawn rows and columns. !

choices.content: ![A rectangle with the right side labeled 7 units and the bottom side labeled 2 units.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d24aeee594fd7b6b7ac7715d552b3d087cc90a83)
![A rectangle with the right side labeled 8 units and the bottom side labeled 6 units.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e2fb9d13754b3fab31da30b8eeb4f8ab6a02b0d6)
![A rectangle with the right side labeled 9 units and the bottom side labeled 9 units.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/925d5723c9e095db0987fdbc29c4af7772e50c42)
![A rectangle with the right side labeled 9 units and the bottom side labeled 6 units.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/595549b6e83bf5d117a84c59f4debf116177fb76)
